capsules_submitted.utterance:
You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's such an iconic character in the wizarding world. As "The Boy Who Lived", he's had to deal with so much pressure and responsibility from a very young age. I think it's really admirable how he's handled all of that, despite the challenges he's faced.

I mean, can you imagine having to live with the knowledge that you're famous in the wizarding world because you survived a killing curse as a baby? It's a lot to take in, and I think Harry has done an amazing job of rising above it all.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been thinking about Hagrid's character in the Harry Potter series. He's definitely a male character, and I'm quite certain about it.
